intro: Adenia lanceolata subsp. lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf adenia, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silky hair. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. These flowers are followed by small, round, woody fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
